name: NPR
text:
The first night of the Democratic National Convention will include dozens of speakers across the U.S.,¬†including:

üé§ Michelle Obama
üé§ Bernie Sanders
üé§ Andrew Cuomo
üé§ Gretchen Whitmer
üé§ Catherine Cortez Masto
üé§ John Kasich
https://t.co/YWrj4kN6Yk

name: NPR
text:
The Democratic National Convention kicks off this evening and runs through Thursday. Here are 5 things to keep in mind.
https://t.co/i5DhecHi0g

name: NPR
text:
‚ÄúI know Joe. He is a profoundly decent man guided by faith,‚Äù Michelle Obama says in a prerecorded video released by the DNC. "He knows what it takes to rescue an economy, beat back a pandemic and lead our country. And he listens."
https://t.co/KgrMtcWKOO

name: NPR
text:
The first night of an unprecedented, all-virtual DNC is about to begin ‚Äî with speeches from Michelle Obama, Bernie Sanders and others.

Follow along as NPR reporters and editors provide real-time analysis ‚§µÔ∏è
https://t.co/BkqPc2cLta

name: NPR
text:
After nearly two decades, federal prosecutors have announced charges against two men in connection with the fatal shooting of Run-DMC's Jam Master Jay in 2002.
https://t.co/kdBgEq6wTI

name: NPR
text:
Kristin Urquiza, whose obit for her dad blamed politicians for failing to stop the coronavirus's spread, is set to criticize Trump tonight. 

‚ÄúMy dad was a healthy 65-year-old,‚Äù she plans to say. ‚ÄúHis only preexisting condition was trusting Donald Trump.‚Äù
https://t.co/1T16j0feXb

name: NPR
text:
AARP is pressing the postmaster general to safeguard voting by mail.

An official says the group ‚Äúhas become increasingly concerned that recent changes ‚Ä¶ may unduly restrict the ability of all Americans to safely participate in the upcoming elections." https://t.co/i2hyDk2dxK

name: NPR
text:
The saxophonist Steve Grossman, whose sure rhythmic footing helped propel him into the spotlight in the 1970s, notably in bands led by Miles Davis and Elvin Jones, died on Aug. 13. He was 69.
https://t.co/rRk2JrNuRR

name: NPR
text:
Three senior producers have left "The Ellen DeGeneres Show" after some of the show's leadership was accused of sexual harassment, racism and creating a toxic work environment, among other allegations.
https://t.co/kl8BK3A3BN

name: NPR
text:
Former Republican Ohio Gov. John Kasich stood at a literal crossroads as he explained why he was crossing party lines to support Joe Biden at the #DemConvention.
https://t.co/Td4zUFcwFl

name: NPR
text:
Michelle Obama is now speaking at the #DemConvention. Watch live:
https://t.co/BpexX2wJoU

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: Michelle Obama: "Over the past four years, a lot of people have asked me, 'When others are going so low, does going high still really work?'"

"My answer: going high is the only thing that works," she said. https://t.co/9TpWpkERIV https://t.co/VCgkWvgcnB

name: NPR
text: Michelle Obama: "If you take one thing from my words tonight, it is this: If you think things cannot possibly get worse, trust me they can ‚Äî and they will ‚Äî if we don't make a change in this election." #DemConvention https://t.co/oMHVCRsecG https://t.co/7Yxcto0xca

name: NPR
text: You can watch Michelle Obama's full DNC address here: https://t.co/b0U1jocMzr

name: NPR
text:
Michelle Obama: "A president's words have the power to move markets. They can start wars or broker peace. ... You simply cannot fake your way through this job. As I've said before, being president doesn't change who you are ‚Äî it reveals who you are."
https://t.co/JlZMpFMltV

name: NPR
text:
The 19th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified 100 years ago this week. 

The final step to secure women that right to vote hinged on a young legislator who switched his vote to yes ‚Äî after his mom asked him to. 
https://t.co/Iu3gRrYFTe

name: NPR
text:
Bernie Sanders: "The future of our democracy is at stake. The future of our economy is at stake. The future of our planet is at stake. We must come together, defeat Donald Trump and elect Joe Biden and Kamala Harris." #DemConvention
https://t.co/pmhQfcbGa3

name: NPR
text:
Michelle Obama has mostly stayed out of the political fray during President Trump's tenure in the White House. 

But on Monday night, she didn't mince words: "Donald Trump is the wrong president for our country."
https://t.co/5ZoZftNiMm

name: NPR
text:
A new study finds that Hispanic and nonwhite workers made up 73% of COVID-19 cases associated with workplace outbreaks in certain industries in Utah ‚Äî despite representing just 24% of the workforce in those sectors.
https://t.co/baLKGyks42

name: NPR
text:
Despite the booming stock market under President Trump, the finance sector is giving more money to Democrats than Republicans.

"People are just exhausted," says one chairman. "You never know what his White House is going to do."
https://t.co/Ra0GBJKH92

name: NPR
text:
A special prosecutor found "substantial abuses of discretion and operational failures" in the Cook County State's Attorney's Office handling of the Jussie Smollett case ‚Äî but nothing to support criminal charges.
https://t.co/zqdSbB3mdm

name: NPR
text:
Jason Wright, a former running back, has been named as the Washington Football Team's president ‚Äî making history as the NFL's first Black, and youngest, team president.
https://t.co/t2Uv7uNFoc

name: NPR
text:
DNC Chair Tom Perez tells NPR that the Democrats are using a wide range of tactics to ensure that as many people as possible have access to the vote. He accused Republicans of explicitly trying to keep people from turning out.
https://t.co/r5g9oze5AS

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration is forging ahead with plans to allow drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. Once drilling rights are sold, it could be harder for a future president to reverse course.
https://t.co/Uyp8kgPFyZ

name: NPR
text:
Death Valley National Park hit a scorching 130 degrees ‚Äî marking what could be the hottest temperature on Earth since at least 1913.

Visitors are getting blunt advice: "Travel prepared to survive."
https://t.co/wHElvHrFoa

name: NPR
text: Firefighters are battling about 15 wildfires across California amid record-breaking temperatures. Rare lighting storms have also sparked a handful of new fires that continue to rage on.  https://t.co/76cbRZjdqr

name: NPR
text:
The Democratic National Convention was absent of a live audience but featured a standout speech from Michelle Obama. 

It also hit President Trump on two major issues ‚Äî the pandemic and the reckoning over racial injustice. 
https://t.co/MO99bvRT28

name: NPR
text:
Public health experts say the evidence is abundantly clear: When bars open, COVID-19 infections tend to follow.

But some bar owners are fighting in court against orders that they stay closed while restaurants are allowed to open.
https://t.co/osv18UbnkH

name: NPR
text:
With indoor dining still prohibited in New York City, officials are allowing restaurants to expand outdoors into the streets. 

But the outdoor eateries are a challenge in areas with narrow sidewalks and tightly packed storefronts. https://t.co/fzbsqh6uRV

name: NPR
text:
Recessions usually impact men more, but this one has ravaged in-person service jobs ‚Äî which are disproportionately done by women. 

Yet unemployment is only part of the story: Women also shoulder more of the load at home. 
https://t.co/fBKcs1apyi

name: NPR
text: Sen. Bernie Sanders urged his progressive supporters to back Joe Biden in November, warning that under the Trump administration, ‚Äúauthoritarianism has taken root in our country." https://t.co/ho1VdGJEzt

name: NPR
text:
On the 100th anniversary of the 19th amendment, President Trump announced he will pardon Susan B. Anthony, the women's suffragist who was arrested in 1872 for illegally voting. 
https://t.co/M5Qc1cdmda

name: NPR
text:
New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern fired back at President Trump‚Äôs claim her country is seeing a "big surge" in COVID-19, calling it "patently wrong.‚Äù

On the same day New Zealand reported 9 new cases ‚Äî the U.S. added nearly 42,000.
https://t.co/4WjM1JvCkj

name: NPR
text: "Unhinged," a road rage movie starring Russell Crowe, will be the first new movie to open nationally in theaters since the pandemic began ‚Äî sparking hope for cinema's comeback. https://t.co/4kTg1Ge7Cg

name: NPR
text: Nearly 16% of FHA mortgages ‚Äî a path to homeownership for many lower-income, minority, and first-time homebuyers ‚Äî are delinquent, the highest level in records going back to 1979. https://t.co/MlS5SU3dal

name: NPR
text: At at time of mass work from home, Amazon is betting that workers will want to return to offices ‚Äî and adding over 905,000 square feet of real estate and 3,500 jobs in New York and five other cities. https://t.co/LSIIRQQvk3

name: NPR
text:
President Trump has sent more political appointees abroad as ambassadors than previous administrations ‚Äî ambassadors "who don't seem to be temperamentally or intellectually suited for the work," says a former diplomat.
https://t.co/xcR488qLBb

name: NPR
text: With voting by mail set for a major expansion because of the pandemic, some worry that thousands of absentee ballots could be rejected because the Postal Service may not postmark the envelope. https://t.co/xQxr6gDFdf

name: NPR
text:
The S&P 500 index closed at a record high Tuesday ‚Äî fully recovering from its plunge earlier this year when coronavirus lockdowns shut down much of the economy.
https://t.co/A9HYRC7Msw

name: NPR
text:
Just two years ago, visitors from the U.S. and overseas contributed more than $90 billion to Florida's economy.

But amid the pandemic, travelers are shying away from the state‚Äôs beaches and theme parks.
https://t.co/rf9nft9Iwd
